text: hi this is Seema and I am back with a
new lesson on the difference between the
words problem trouble and issue well all
these three words sound very similar
don't they well in a way they are but
there are certain things that
distinguish each of these words from
each other now what are these
differences so before we go into the
differences let's deal with one word at
a time we will deal with the first word
which is problem now this word is a word
you use very often we all have problems
but you know what a problem always has a
solution and therefore if I want to use
the word problem in a sentence I need to
make sure that the usage of problem
comes only when the problem that I am
stating can be solved so basically
anything that is solvable is a problem
my first sentence says I have a problem
with my phone now let's look at what the
problem is a problem with your phone can
that be solved
it very well could so therefore I use
the word problem I won't say I have I
have you know trouble with my phone or
an issue with my phone though that
wouldn't be wrong but problem would be
the more apt word for this sentence the
next sentence talks about there's a
problem with the internet speed we all
have these kind of problems well again
we need to check is there a solution to
it can it be solved well of course it
can and therefore I will use the word
problem
then like I did with the first sentence
and the most common sentence we all know
is every problem has a solution and
again I use the word problem because I
am reiterating the fact that a problem
is always solvable and therefore when
I'm using the word problem I'm talking
about a negative thing but something
that can always be solved now that we've
learned how to use the word problem
we will now see how to use the word
trouble
well trouble is not so much connected to
finding a solution like the word problem
is but trouble is more connected to a
negative feeling or when bad things
happen when bad things happen there is
always this very negative feeling that
we we go through so that's when you will
use the word trouble let's see how the
first sentence says I am late I'm in
deep trouble why do I use the word
trouble and not problem or issue for
that matter I use the word trouble
because I'm talking about a negative
feeling because of a bad thing that has
happened and the bad thing out here is
being late and therefore I've got this
negative feeling going on now inside me
which is why I say I'm late
I am in deep trouble I do not say I am
in the problem or I'm in deep issue I
say I am in deep trouble let's look at
the other sentence it says if you have
trouble understanding the report give me
a call I wouldn't really use the word
problem or issue out here I
say trouble again because I'm talking
about a a bad thing happening or
something that is not you know in my
favor if I don't understand a report
that does not really go very well with
me that brings about a negative feeling
and therefore I again use the word
trouble well this is something that you
know a lot of your mothers have probably
warned you about and as you as you were
growing up you've heard this very often
it says this kid is a troublemaker okay
so I've used the word trouble and not an
issue maker or a problem maker is
because your mother who really is
concerned about you wants to make sure
that nothing bad happens to you and she
has a negative feeling when something
bad happens to you so she will use the
word trouble
that boy is trouble don't date him that
kid is trouble so you see we use the
word trouble when we want to tap or talk
about negative feelings that could talk
about a bad situation that has already
happened or that may happen in the
future let us now see how we can use the
word issue another very common word
issue well when do I use the word issue
as opposed to using problem and trouble
well I will use the word issue when I
want to talk about a disagreement or
maybe making some difficult decisions or
maybe things that are very debatable you
know a lot of debates and controversies
that happen over something so they are
categorized under the word issue so
debates or something that is very
debatable well let's see a few sentences
to make the point the first one is
she has issues with everyone now why do
I use the word issues and not problem or
trouble well in this case I will not use
the word problem or trouble and I will
only use the word
issues because I'm talking about
disagreements I'm talking about being a
very difficult person and this person
that we're talking about has issues is
not cordial with people it's always in
the midst of a controversy and therefore
I will use the word issues as opposed to
the other two words let's look at the
next sentence this sentence says the
issue with our deal is the cost so we're
talking about you know a group of people
working out a budget a financial budget
maybe and of course in a financial
budget the issue is the cost now I use
the word issue because the financial
budget so to speak is debatable and it
may not be agreed upon by all the people
involved and therefore there is
disagreement to a certain extent but I
also want to add that in this sentence
you can use the word problem because
sometimes an issue is a problem that can
be solved so an issue and problem can be
used both in this sentence but mostly
you use the word issue because as I said
we're dealing with disagreements we're
dealing with possible debates we're
dealing with a bit of controversy and
our next sentence says there are many
political issues in many countries now
political issues you know I don't need
to tell you what they are you know them
you know them all already so issues
which are political obviously have a lot
of disagreements they're not they're
always debated upon they are always
things that need to be discussed over
and over
again so that's when I will use the word
political issues I will not say
political troubles or political problems
though that wouldn't be wrong but issues
would be more apt because of its
definition well that's it for me on this
lesson on the difference between the
usage of words trouble problem and
issues I hope you've enjoyed it and
learned from it this is me saying
goodbye and I'll see you with some more
lesson
